we are talking about his cameo, don't need to repeat that fact.............on a side note, I'm gotten to 667 edits for this page...no more [[Satan|mark of the beast]]..*whipes sweat*

too early to pick from film which scenes are most important, and image is too large for fair use
/* Sequel */ Rem. redundant info... Raimi himself shares his own perspective in the next sentence, so a 2006 citation of a second party talking about him isn't necessary anymore
/* References */ We don't have any reason to reference the novelization, and "Further reading" is akin to "External links" in listing supplementary sources, just in print instead
/* Marketing */ Does not meet fair use anymore... maybe we should explore including a more visible Venom image, not here, but somewhere else in the article?
/* Music */ Removed two references and replaced them with reference directly to blog entry instead of the blog in general
/* Cast and characters */ fix MJ link
retitled to Music per talk page
/* Sequel */ the Mag/quire part always trips me up
Reduced to five major players; the rest can be seen in the Cast section
/* Marketing */ Getting ahead of myself here
Rem. extraneous info about books and created Further reading section with book details
Removed extraneous detail about books, created Further reading section for book details
/* External links */ Included lengthy article here because it provides a lot of supplementary insight to the film

novelizations don't always follow the film exactly, but niether do empire magazine previews. And a novelization, plus a movie storybook, are infinately stronger evidence than empire magazine.

It may have said that in the comics, but in the book of the movie, it says it comes to earth from a meteoroid.
Revert; novelization does not always match the film. See [[Superman Returns]] and its novelization for a good example about the kid
made synopsis accurate, source, official Spider-Man 3 Novelization http://rapidshare.com/files/21529138/SM3_SUMMARY.doc.html

revert, no source, EMPIRE is a source, images are not sources
